intro: Adelobotrys monticola subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This subspecies is characterized by its hairy stems, heart-shaped leaves, and showy pink to purple flowers. It typically grows in rocky or open habitats at higher elevations. The plant is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
